name: beekir
text:
@roytang It was totally possible to be a fully capable full stack developer in 2009.

Yes there were A LOT of APIs even then, but with enough experience (and a lot of studying) it was entirely within reach for young professionals.

Today, I do agree with your premise that full stack is dead.

But you don’t have to go back 30 years to find a time when it thrived.

I was there less than 15 years ago (and coding QBasic 30 years ago, because I didn’t even have the internet then. Who did?)
